column9: is this a real map or a test?

so it's suposed to last

most cities are called "simcity"

I didn't played on last one :)
oh
last online I played was one year ago I think
I seee....
simcity bc there are more cities than names in the config gile
file
yea you are right, most cities are named simcity
it seems like he autogenerated this map
yep
which is odd, he usually uses well designed ones
are you going to play this one? man I have looots of latency
can't build, takes lots of time, is this normal?
I don't think I will;  sometimes there is lag like that, but
but it's uncommmon for it to happen when a map starts
oookay
do you use the forums?
wait, yeah you said you do :)
yea, quite often
you might want to mention that this map is buggy.  maybe he should have someone fix it and restart
good, will to now
someone could probably tweak this map in a few hours to fix it
yea, I guess they will fix the names
appart from that all looks ok
yeah, lots of cities is good
ah.... ouch, you are starting out with passenger :)\
I'll play a bit, I guess I'll end bankrupt hehe
you know how passenger & mail works right?
each passenger has a specific spot on the map it wants to go just like industry
so if most of the map does not have passenger connections, you won't get much passenger
yeah but it's hard to start when there are not much destinations
ok, good.... hmm, well a city with lots of factories around it might help
I'll give it a try and see if just intra-city traffic makes money, to wait more players connect routes here
but, what we did last game was have a public airport exchange
once a lot of players put passenger in cities and connected to that exchange it got easy
yea that makes sense, on the last sucessful game I played we had like 4-5 exchanges on biggest cities
just one exchange does not work so good maybe
does it get slower when I'm on?
it's allways slow
unplayable in fact for me
hmm, le tme try bulding and see what happens
working ok so far, what country you in?
north, birmingham
is internet connection good there?
yeah, maybe it's my computer
what processor you got?
100% cpu usage
oh, maybe it is then  .... only 1 core?
core 2 duo
no, 2
I don't know if that's fast enough or not, but here's a way to check things
I think it's because I had transparent trees on
Go to game options > display
works better now
check out "game options" (the first button) > display
got it
see the frame time, idle, fps, and simloops at bottom of that?
ok good, well, there's is another thing you can check.....
go to "game options" > "save" and save this game
then.... load it in single player mode
and run at FAST speed
see if those frametime idle, fps, simploops get really bad
if your computer if fast enough, they should stay pretty good
disabling transparent trees fixed things
it's ok now, thanks a lot :)
oh..... a graphics issue then.... maybe your graphics card is slow then
I"m guesing it's just the default built in video card
yeah that might be one of the problems, I'll have it a look :)
maybe even not a real card, but just a chip on the moteherboard?
well one thing you should try:  find out the exact model video card whether built in or not
then download the latest drivers from intel, nvidia, or amd/ati
might be worth a try
I think it's some problem in simutrans code, I'll have it a look when I got more time, because I'm one of the guys that semake code on simutrans. I'm not a big contributor yet so far through
well, in that case you can always benchmark the trees code and see what's going on :)
trees have allways been a huge problem, I'm in fact trying to make a 3D version of this game
and trees is one of the things that give more problems so far to me
when you say 3d, do you mean using 3d to generate a nice 2d image like we have now .... or
3d where you actually rotate from any angle ?
I'm focusing in displaying the same images using 3D routines to speed things up and have arbitrary levels of zoom, using the same images we have now
to re-use the current paks, but the last oal is going 100% 3D
*goal
hmm, well that would require two different code paths.... right?
hmm not sure how to say waht I mean
My idea is expanding simutrans in increments if you know what I mean
write the 3D accelerated simuttrans that whould look very similar to the one today
like, if you want 100% 3d, that's like a big rewrite ... that might as we not bother with doing the other one
and add 3D functionality later, all in the same game, not as a different game
have you ever thought about making your own game or something?
no, because I like this one
I just want this game to get better, not making a new game
I wish the game code was under a bsd or mit license or similar
but I guess it won't matter to most poeople or make much difference to em
what languages do you program in?
or maybe what languages do you like to program in?
it will stay same license as current simutrans has
I just contribute code to the community, it'0s not a fork
oh, I meant, the current simutrans, I wish was under a non-restrictive license
for this project, it's C++ obviously :)
did you have other languages yo used to use?/like?
it's artistic license
artistic license is somewhat similar to BSD license
it's not GNU
really?  I thought it required no commercial use and had a copyleft to?
personally I use to write in javascript, PHP, perl and shell-scripting
ah, have you messed out with much 3d/opengl/directx yet?
a bit, but I'm not an expert
did some 3D programming in my degree but I'm not an absolute expert at all
but if you find it fun.... :)
I don't know the details of artistic license, but allows to sell the game if the community decides so, and requires the authour's names to be cited in the non-commercial distribution I think
if you ever want to... check out a game engine called "irrlicht"
3D is very interesting
this game was written in a oposite way of thinking through, it's being hard to shift it to 3D
they thought and with all the reason to, oriented to writing to a framebuffer
irrlicht.sourceforge.net
